name: users.profile.set
desc: Use this method to set a user's profile information, including name, email, current status, and other attributes.

user.desc: ID of user to change. This argument may only be specified by team admins on paid teams.

profile.desc: Collection of key:value pairs presented as a URL-encoded JSON hash.

name.desc: Name of a single key to set. Usable only if profile is not passed.

value.desc: Value to set a single key to. Usable only if profile is not passed.

errors.reserved_name: First or last name are reserved.
errors.invalid_profile: Profile object passed in is not valid JSON (make sure it is URL encoded!).
errors.not_admin: Only admins can update the profile of another user.
errors.not_app_admin: Only team owners and selected members can update the profile of a bot user.
errors.cannot_update_admin_user: Only a primary owner can update the profile of an admin.
errors.account_inactive: Authentication token is for a deleted user or team.
errors.user_is_bot: This method cannot be called by a bot user.
errors.invalid_arg_name: The method was passed an argument whose name falls outside the bounds of common decency. This includes very long names and names with non-alphanumeric characters other than _. If you get this error, it is typically an indication that you have made a very malformed API call.
errors.invalid_array_arg: The method was passed a PHP-style array argument (e.g. with a name like foo[7]). These are never valid with the Slack API.
errors.invalid_charset: The method was called via a POST request, but the charset specified in the Content-Type header was invalid. Valid charset names are: utf-8 iso-8859-1.
errors.invalid_form_data: The method was called via a POST request with Content-Type application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data, but the form data was either missing or syntactically invalid.
errors.invalid_post_type: The method was called via a POST request, but the specified Content-Type was invalid. Valid types are: application/x-www-form-urlencoded multipart/form-data text/plain.
errors.missing_post_type: The method was called via a POST request and included a data payload, but the request did not include a Content-Type header.
errors.request_timeout: The method was called via a POST request, but the POST data was either missing or truncated.
